title: Jimmy Carter in his own words: Notable quotes by former US President
description: Jimmy Carter, the 39th U.S. President, is remembered for his commitment to morality in leadership, his focus on peace and human rights, and his reflections on societal challenges. His legacy is marked by humility, thoughtfulness, and lifelong service to others.

html:
Jimmy Carter, the 39th President of the United States, leaves behind a remarkable legacy of wisdom, as reflected in his own words across decades of public service, diplomacy, and personal introspection. His quotations serve as a window into the mind of a leader deeply committed to humanity, humility, and hope.
On leadership and morality
"We have a tendency to exalt ourselves and to dwell on the weaknesses and mistakes of others. I have come to realize that in every person there is something fine and pure and noble." – Why Not the Best? (1975)
Carter consistently emphasized the importance of morality in leadership. In his inaugural address in 1977, he declared, "This inauguration ceremony marks a new beginning...but only a people can provide it," highlighting the shared responsibility of government and citizens to build a better future.

A crisis of confidence
In his famous 1979 "malaise" speech, Carter observed, "It’s clear that the true problems of our nation are much deeper...It is a crisis of confidence," pointing to the need for unity and trust in challenging times.
On war and peace
"War may sometimes be a necessary evil. But no matter how necessary, it is always an evil, never a good." – Nobel Peace Prize acceptance speech (2002)
Carter's commitment to peace and human rights remained unwavering throughout his life, from his presidency to his work at The

Carter Center.
Reflections on society and progress
Carter often spoke candidly about America’s struggles and aspirations. "I had a very challenging question...‘How would you describe the United States of America today in one word?’...I finally said, ‘Searching.’" – 90th birthday celebration (2014)
He also highlighted enduring challenges in his 2014 book, A Call to Action, writing, "The most serious and unaddressed worldwide challenge is the deprivation and abuse of women and girls."
A life of gratitude
Carter reflected on his personal journey with profound humility. "The life we have now is the best of all...We are blessed with good health and look to the future with eagerness and confidence." – A Full Life (2015)
Jimmy Carter’s words remind us of the enduring power of thoughtfulness, integrity, and a lifelong commitment to serving others. Through his reflections, he continues to inspire a vision of a better world.
